name: treacherously
content:
treacherously adverb
(DANGEROUSLY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is extremely dangerous, especially because of bad weather conditions: The pavement was treacherously icy. The boat began to roll treacherously in the water.
More examplesFewer examplesThe course of the race took the runners through deep canyons in treacherously hot conditions.I tried to find a firm foothold as the ground shifted treacherously beneath me.The van weaved treacherously in and out of the other traffic.

treacherously adverb
(NOT LOYAL)
in a way that involves deceiving or behaving badly to someone who trusts you: The prince was treacherously murdered by his younger brother. He was treacherously seized and thrown into prison.
More examplesFewer examplesThe minister has acted treacherously in this matter.She has behaved foolishly and treacherously, and we still don't know why.
